text:
Are you looking to plug coordinates into a module field and have it output onto a map?

Or, are you looking to have a client/customer upload coordinates onto a field, and then that, display on a map.

For the former, this should be possible using the exact coordinates of the locations as text fields and then inserting it's respective HubL into

```<https://maps.google.com/maps?q={{lattitude_hubL}},{{longitude_hubL}}&hl=es;z=14&output=embed>```
For the latter, on CMS , you can output <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/crm-objects|CRM Properties through the CRM>. With that, only the "products" or "marketing events" crm objects are available for publicly facing pages on Pro.  With Enterprise, you can leverage custom objects. On either subscription, you can display contact/company/deal/ticket/etc data on a page. All that being said, you can have a Property (whatever is best suited for the business) filled out via form, and then, using the CRM_objects function or CRM objects field in a custom module, leverage the responses as HubL in the same manner of the former to plug that into an embed (with respectively different syntax)
